Text: You need to do some research on resolution. It is the proper resolution at a lower bit rate. There are no better available for the first two seasons. It is 720p.
I stand corrected, but seeing as this is a cartoon.. 6.5 GBs for no noticeable difference is not worth it. I've watched the two and they look nearly identical.
Why rename the source files? It just makes it so much harder to figure ut which subtitle files are compatible when you have removed "IMMERSE" or whatever. :/
That's my standard file naming scheme for my TV collections. When this is reuploaded as season 3 completes I will include subtitles.
Thanks for the upload, but can you please update us with a comment here when the torrent has been updated to include all season 3.

as for the comment about 80mb files not being 720p - -

All I can say is I'm amazed at the quality of those images!!!  If this was a continous-tone (photo) then the complaint about 80mb not being HD may be valid, but this is animated so it works GREAT! 

When I convert these to MP4's (my preferred format for my AppleTV) they expand into average of 380MB files. So if you want a large file, that's it. 380MB for 21 minutes of video can pass for HD. Abd the quality is still superb!

Don't knock it until you try it!
